pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau Speaks with Speaker of the U.S. House of Representatives Paul Ryan | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, the Prime Minister, Justin Trudeau, spoke with the Speaker of the United States House of Representatives, Paul Ryan, to discuss a range of Canada-U.S. trade issues.

The Prime Minister and Speaker Ryan emphasized the complementary and integrated nature of steel and aluminum industries on both sides of the border. They discussed the importance of maintaining free and open trade between Canada and the United States, and cooperating to address global overcapacity and unfair trade.  

The United States is Canada's closest ally. Canada is a safe and secure supplier of steel and aluminum to the U.S., recognized under U.S. law as part of the U.S. defense industrial complex. Canada is the top customer of U.S. steel, accounting for close to 50 per cent of U.S. steel exports. Canadian aluminum exports support more than 160,000 workers in the United States.

The Prime Minister and Speaker Ryan also noted issues of importance to both Canada and the United States in the NAFTA negotiations, including agriculture and investment protection.
